required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Multiple Rising Oral Dose Study of PG 760564 Administered Twice Daily to Healthy Male/Female Volunteers for 14 Days
clinical_study.official_title: Multiple Ascending Oral Dose Study to Assess the Safety, Tolerability, and Pharmacokinetics of PG 760564 Administered Twice Daily to Healthy Male and Female Volunteers for 14 Days (27 Doses).

brief_summary.textblock: This study is a multiple ascending dose study to Assess the Safety, Tolerability, and Pharmacokinetics of orally dosed PG 760564 Administered Twice Daily to Healthy Male and Female Volunteers for 14 Days (27 Doses).

detailed_description.textblock: This study is a multiple ascending dose study to Assess the Safety, Tolerability, and Pharmacokinetics of orally dosed PG 760564 Administered Twice Daily to Healthy Male and Female Volunteers for 14 Days (27 Doses). The study is a multiple rising dose (MRD) study of active drug vs. placebo.

primary_outcome.measure: AUCτ Over a Dosing Interval (τ = 12 Hours) on Day 14
primary_outcome.description: the area under the plasma concentration-time curve over a dosing interval (τ = 12 hours) on Day 14 of Multiple Dose Oral Administration of PG-760564 Given Every 12 Hours

primary_outcome.measure: Cmax Over a Dosing Interval (τ = 12 Hours)on Day 14
primary_outcome.description: Maximum plasma concentration (Cmax) over a dosing interval (τ = 12 hours)on Day 14

primary_outcome.measure: Tmax Over a Dosing Interval (τ = 12 Hours) on Day 14
primary_outcome.description: the time at which maximum plasma concentration occurred (Tmax) Over a Dosing Interval (τ = 12 Hours) on Day 14

primary_outcome.measure: t½,z Over a Dosing Interval (τ = 12 Hours)on Day 14
primary_outcome.time_frame: over a Dosing Interval (τ = 12 Hours) on Day 14
primary_outcome.description: t½,z is the terminal exponential half-life; over a Dosing Interval (τ = 12 Hours)on Day 14

participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: Each Subject enrolled in the study, participated in one period only (e.g., subjects did not start in the 50mg dose group, then proceed to subsequent groups)

group.title: Placebo
group.description: placebo capsule. This study consisted of 4 sequential periods testing rising doses of PG 760564. Each period randomized participants to receive either placebo or a specific dose of PG 760564. Subjects enrolled in a period participated in that period only.

group.title: 50 mg PG 760564
group.description: 50 mg PG 760564 Administered Twice for 14 Days (27 Doses). Subjects enrolled in this period participated in one period only (e.g., subjects did not start in the 50mg dose group, then proceed to subsequent groups)

group.title: 100 mg PG 760564
group.description: 100 mg PG 760564 Administered Twice for 14 Days (27 Doses). Subjects enrolled in this period participated in one period only (e.g., subjects did not start in the 100mg dose group, then proceed to subsequent groups)

group.title: 200 mg PG 760564
group.description: 200 mg PG 760564 Administered Twice for 14 Days (27 Doses). Subjects enrolled in this period participated in one period only (e.g., subjects did not start in the 200mg dose group, then proceed to subsequent groups)

group.title: 400 mg PG 760564
group.description: 400 mg PG 760564 Administered Twice for 14 Days (27 Doses). Subjects enrolled in this period participated in one period only (e.g., subjects did not start in the 400mg dose group, then proceed to subsequent groups)

group.title: Total
group.description: Total of all reporting groups

measure.title: Age
measure.description: This study consisted of 4 sequential periods testing rising doses of PG 760564. Each period randomized participants to receive either placebo or a specific dose of PG 760564. Subjects enrolled in a single period (i.e., no subject participated in more than one period)

measure.description: This study consisted of 4 sequential periods testing rising doses of PG 760564. Each period randomized participants to receive either placebo or a specific dose of PG 760564. Subjects enrolled in a single period (i.e., no subject participated in more than one period)

outcome.title: AUCτ Over a Dosing Interval (τ = 12 Hours) on Day 14
outcome.description: the area under the plasma concentration-time curve over a dosing interval (τ = 12 hours) on Day 14 of Multiple Dose Oral Administration of PG-760564 Given Every 12 Hours
outcome.population: PG 760564 blood plasma concentrations were not measured for the placebo arm

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Data, calculations, interpretations, opinions, and recommendations are the property of P&GP. In the event study results are published in the scientific literature by P&GP, acknowledgment will be made to the Investigator(s) in the accepted style, as appropriate.
